net.grinder.communication
Interface ResourcePool

All Known Implementing Classes:
ResourcePoolImplementation
interface ResourcePool

A pool of resources.

Each resource in the pool is wrapped in a wrapper that keeps track of whether it is currently in use. Clients access resources through ResourcePool.Reservations.

Author:
Philip Aston

Nested Class Summary
static interface ResourcePool.Closeable
          Something that can be closed.
static interface ResourcePool.Listener
          Listener interface.
static interface ResourcePool.Reservation
          Public interface to a resource reservation.
static interface ResourcePool.Resource
          Public interface to a resource.

Method Detail

add

ResourcePool.Closeable add(ResourcePool.Resource resource)
Adds a resource to the pool.

Parameters:
resource - The resource to add.
Returns:
Allows the client to notify the resource pool if the resource has been closed.

reserveNext

ResourcePool.Reservation reserveNext()
Returns a resource, reserved for exclusive use by the caller.

Resources are handed out to callers in order. A Sentinel is returned once every cycle; if no resources are free the Sentinel is always returned.

Returns:
The resource. It is up to the caller to free or close the resource.

reserveAll

List<? extends ResourcePool.Reservation> reserveAll()
Returns a list of reservations for all the current resources. Blocks until all Reservations can be reserved. The Sentinel is not included in the list.

Returns:
The resources. It is up to the caller to free or close each resource.

closeCurrentResources

void closeCurrentResources()
Close the resources currently in the pool. Resources can be closed while reserved.

This doesn't "shutdown" the pool. I don't want to introduce an extra shutdown state, and the pollute our interface with a shutdown exception. It's up to the owner of the pool to prevent new things from being added to the pool if necessary.

countActive

int countActive()
Count the active resources.

Returns:
The number of active resources.

addListener

void addListener(ResourcePool.Listener listener)
Add a new listener.

Parameters:
listener - The listener.
